modules.name: Workplace Scenarios
modules.instructions: Choose the most effective course of action. [cite: 191]

questions.text: You are the team leader for a project. One member is consistently not completing their part of the work, causing delays. [cite_start]You would: [cite: 192, 193]

options.text: Report them to the teacher immediately. [cite: 194]
Talk to them in private to understand if they have a problem. [cite: 195]
Do their work yourself to avoid delays. [cite: 196]
Complain about them to other team members. [cite: 197]

questions.text: You discover a mistake in a report just after your team has submitted it. This mistake could lower your team's grade. [cite_start]You would: [cite: 198, 199]

options.text: Hope the teacher doesn't notice it. [cite: 200]
Blame the team member responsible for that section. [cite: 201]
Immediately inform the teacher about the mistake and ask for a chance to correct it. [cite: 202]
Discuss it with the team and decide to keep quiet. [cite: 203]

questions.text: You are given a very challenging task that you have never done before. [cite_start]You would: [cite: 204, 205]

options.text: Tell your teacher you can't do it.
Try to do it on your own, researching and learning as you go. [cite: 206]
Ask a friend to do it for you. [cite: 207]
Break down the task, attempt what you can, and ask for help on specific parts you're stuck on. [cite: 208]

questions.text: A classmate suggests using an unfair method (like copying from the internet) to win an inter-school competition. [cite_start]You would: [cite: 209]

options.text: Agree because you want to win at any cost. [cite: 210]
Disagree and explain that it's unethical and the risk is not worth it. [cite: 211]
Stay quiet and let the others decide. [cite: 212]
Tell the classmate you won't participate if they cheat, and try to convince others too. [cite: 213]

questions.text: Your teacher gives you feedback that your presentation style is not engaging. [cite_start]You would: [cite: 214]

options.text: Feel disheartened and ignore the feedback. [cite: 215]
Argue with the teacher, defending your style. [cite: 216]
Thank the teacher and ask for specific tips on how you can improve. [cite: 217]
Think the teacher is biased against you. [cite: 218]

modules.name: Work Values
modules.instructions: Rank the following from 1 (Most Important) to 3 (Least Important) for you in a future career. [cite: 220]

questions.text: What is most important to you? [cite: 221]
I would prefer a job that: [cite: 225]
items: Allows me to be creative and innovative. [cite: 226]
Gives me a position of power and leadership. [cite: 227]
The opportunity to learn new things constantly. [cite: 230]
A friendly and supportive work environment. [cite: 231]
The chance to become famous or well-respected in my field. [cite: 232]

questions.text: I would be happiest if my job: [cite: 233]
items: Involves traveling and exploring new places. [cite: 234]
Challenges me with difficult problems to solve. [cite: 236]

questions.text: When choosing a career, my top priority is: [cite: 237]
items: Independence and the freedom to make my own decisions. [cite: 238]
Working for a prestigious and well-known company (e.g., Google, Tata). [cite: 239]
Work that aligns with my personal passions and hobbies. [cite: 240]
